The link suggestions metabox contains a: The link suggestions meta box contains a list of posts on your blog with similar content that might be interesting to link to.
Find relevant data about your content ri: Find relevant data about your content right in the Insights section in the Yoast SEO metabox. You’ll see what words you use most often and if they’re a match with your keywords!

Please enter a search term that is longe: Please enter a search term that is longer than 3 characters.
You are about to discard all unsaved cha: You are about to discard all unsaved changes. All of your settings will be reset to the point where you last saved. Are you sure you want to do this?
You have selected the user %1$s%5$s%2$s: You have selected the user %1$s%5$s%2$s as the person this site represents. Their user profile information will now be used in search results. %3$sUpdate their profile to make sure the information is correct%4$s.
Please tell us more about the person thi: Please tell us more about the person this site represents.
Tell us if you have any other profiles o: Tell us if you have any other profiles on the web that belong to your organisation. This can be any number of profiles, like YouTube, LinkedIn, Pinterest, or even Wikipedia.
Please tell us more about your organizat: Please tell us more about your organisation. This information will help Google to understand your website, and improve your chance of getting rich results.
Choose whether your site represents an o: Choose whether your site represents an organisation or a person.
This info is intended to appear in %1$sG: This info is intended to appear in %1$sGoogle's Knowledge Graph%2$s. You can be either an organisation or a person.
Tell us about the other profiles on the: Tell us about the other profiles on the web that belong to the person.
Oops! Something went wrong while retriev: Oops! Something went wrong while retrieving the user social profiles.
You can determine the title and descript: You can determine the title and description for the blog page by %1$sediting the blog page itself%2$s.
These are expert features, so make sure: These are expert features, so make sure you know what you're doing before removing the parameters. %1$sRead more about how your site can be affected%2$s.
Prevent crawling of internal site search: Prevent crawling of internal site search URLs
Block internal site searches which match: Block internal site searches which match the patterns of known spam attacks.
Block internal site searches which conta: Block internal site searches which contain complex and non-alphanumeric characters, as they may be part of a spam attack.
Limit the length of internal site search: Limit the length of internal site search queries to reduce the impact of spam attacks and confusing URLs.
Enables advanced settings for protecting: Enables advanced settings for protecting your internal site search URLs.
Your internal site search can create lot: Your internal site search can create lots of confusing URLs for search engines, and can even be used as a way for SEO spammers to attack your site. Most sites will benefit from experimenting with these protections and optimisations, even if you don’t have a search feature in your theme.
Add a \u2018disallow\u2019 rule to your: Add a ‘disallow’ rule to your robots.txt file to prevent crawling of WordPress' JSON API endpoints.
Remove JavaScript used for converting em: Remove JavaScript used for converting emoji characters in older browsers.
Remove URLs which provide alternative (l: Remove URLs which provide alternative (legacy) formats of all of the above.
Remove URLs which provide information ab: Remove URLs which provide information about your search results.
Remove URLs which provide information about your recent posts, for each custom taxonomy.
Remove URLs which provide information about your recent posts, for each tag.
Remove URLs which provide information about your recent posts, for each category.
Remove URLs which provide information about your recent posts, for each post type.
Remove URLs which provide information about recent posts by specific authors.
Remove URLs which provide information about recent comments on each post.
Remove URLs which provide an overview of: Remove URLs which provide an overview of recent comments on your site.
Remove URLs which provide an overview of your recent posts.
WordPress outputs your content in many d: WordPress outputs your content in many different formats, across many different URLs (like RSS feeds of your posts and categories). It’s generally good practice to disable the formats you’re not actively using.
Remove links which allow others sites to: Remove links which allow others sites to ‘ping’ yours when they link to you.
Remove information about the plugins and: Remove information about the plugins and software used by your site.
Remove links used for embedding your con: Remove links used for embedding your content on other sites.
Remove links used by external systems fo: Remove links used by external systems for publishing content to your blog.
Remove links to the location of your sit: Remove links to the location of your site’s REST API endpoints.
Remove links to WordPress' internal 'sho: Remove links to WordPress' internal 'shortlink' URLs for your posts.
Prevents specific URL parameters from be: Prevents specific URL parameters from being removed by the above feature. E.g., adding %1$s will prevent %2$s from being redirected to %3$s
Removes unknown URL parameters via a %1$: Removes unknown URL parameters via a %1$s redirect. E.g., %2$s will be redirected to %3$s
Replaces %1$s tracking parameters with t: Replaces %1$s tracking parameters with the (more performant) %2$s equivalent, via a %3$s redirect. E.g., %4$s will be redirected to %5$s
Users and search engines may often reque: Users and search engines may often request your URLs whilst using query parameters, like %1$s. These can be helpful for tracking, filtering, and powering advanced functionality - but they come with a performance and SEO ‘cost’. Sites which don’t rely on URL parameters might benefit from using these options.
Add a \u2018disallow\u2019 rule to your: Add a ‘disallow’ rule to your robots.txt file to prevent crawling of %1$s and %2$s URLs.
WordPress adds a lot of links and conten: WordPress adds a lot of links and content to your site's %1$s and HTTP headers. Most people can safely disable all of these, which can help to save bytes, electricity, and trees.
Make your site more efficient and more e: Make your site more efficient and more environmentally friendly by preventing search engines from crawling things they don’t need to, and by removing unused WordPress features. %1$sLearn more about crawl settings and how they could benefit your site%2$s.
You can always choose to enable\/disable: You can always choose to enable/disable them for your theme below. This setting will not apply to breadcrumbs inserted through a widget, a block or a shortcode.
Choose which Post type you wish to show: Choose which Post type you wish to show in the breadcrumbs for Taxonomies.
Choose which Taxonomy you wish to show i: Choose which Taxonomy you wish to show in the breadcrumbs for Post types.
Choose the general appearance of your br: Choose the general appearance of your breadcrumbs.
Configure the appearance and behavior of: Configure the appearance and behaviour of your breadcrumbs.
Disabling this will redirect the %1$s to: Disabling this will redirect the %1$s to your site's homepage.
Unfortunately, this means that all your: Unfortunately, this means that all your unsaved changes will be lost. You can try and refresh this page to resolve the problem. If this error still occurs, please get in touch with our support team, and we'll get you all the help you need!
Something went wrong. An unexpected erro: Something went wrong. An unexpected error occurred.
Be the first to get %1$snew features & t: Be the first to get %1$snew features & tools%2$s, before everyone else. Get %1$s24/7 support%2$s and boost your website’s visibility.

Configure the basics for your website.
This field updates the %1$sTagline in yo: This field updates the %1$sTagline in your WordPress settings%2$s.
This field updates the %1$sSite title in: This field updates the %1$sSite title in your WordPress settings%2$s.
Choose how your %1$s pages should be des: Choose how your %1$s pages should be described by default in your site's Schema.org markup. You can change these setting per individual %2$s page.
Disabling this means that %1$s pages cre: Disabling this means that %1$s pages created by WordPress will not be indexed by search engines and will be excluded from XML sitemaps.
Choose how your %1$s pages should look i: Choose how your %1$s pages should look in search engines. You can always customise this per individual %2$s page.
We recommend disabling %1$s pages. Disab: We recommend disabling %1$s pages. Disabling %1$s pages will cause all attachment URLs to redirect to the media itself.
When you upload media (e.g. an image or: When you upload media (e.g. an image or video), %5$s automatically creates a %3$s page (attachment URL) for it. These pages are quite empty and could cause %1$sthin content problems and lead to excess pages on your site%2$s. Therefore, %4$s disables them by default (and redirects the attachment URL to the media itself).
Choose how your Homepage should look on: Choose how your Homepage should look on social media. Note that this is what people probably will see when they search for your brand name.
Format-based archives can cause duplicat: Format-based archives can cause duplicate content issues. For most sites, we recommend that you disable this setting.
Disabling this means that %1$s will not: Disabling this means that %1$s will not be indexed by search engines and will be excluded from XML sitemaps. We recommend that you disable this setting.
%1$s can cause duplicate content issues. For most sites, we recommend that you disable this setting.
%1$s (e.g. %2$s) are based on publicatio: %1$s (e.g. %2$s) are based on publication dates. From an SEO perspective, the posts in these archives have no real relation to the other posts except for their publication dates, which doesn’t say much about the content. They could also lead to duplicate content issues. This is why we recommend you to disable %1$s.
Choose how your %1$s should look on soci: Choose how your %1$s should look on social media by default.
Disabling this means that archives for a: Disabling this means that archives for authors without any posts will not be indexed by search engines and will be excluded from XML sitemaps.
Show archives for authors without posts: Show archives for authors without posts in search results
Choose how your %1$s should look in sear: Choose how your %1$s should look in search engines.
If you're running a one author blog, the: If you're running a one author blog, the %1$s (e.g. %2$s) will be exactly the same as your homepage. This is what's called a %3$sduplicate content problem%4$s. If this is the case on your site, you can choose to either disable it (which makes it redirect to the homepage), or prevent it from showing up in search results.
Read more about the search results setti: Read more about the search results settings
Choose how your %1$s should look in sear: Choose how your %1$s should look in search engines and on social media.

WordPress loads lots of resources, some: WordPress loads lots of resources, some of which your site might not need. If you’re not using these, removing them can speed up your pages and save resources.

Category URLs in WordPress contain a pre: Category URLs in WordPress contain a prefix, usually %s. This enables that prefix, for categories only.
Choose how your %1$s archive should look: Choose how your %1$s archive should look on social media.
Disabling this means that the archive fo: Disabling this means that the archive for %1$s will not be indexed by search engines and will be excluded from XML sitemaps.

You haven't set a Shop page in your WooC: You haven't set a Shop page in your WooCommerce settings. %1$sPlease do this first%2$s.
The %1$sSocial image%2$s, %1$sSocial tit: The %1$sSocial image%2$s, %1$sSocial title%2$s and %1$sSocial description%2$s require Open Graph data, which is currently disabled in the ‘Social sharing’ section in %3$sSite features%4$s.
Oh no! It seems your form contains inval: Oh no! It seems your form contains invalid data. Please review the following fields:

Verify your site with different tools. T: Verify your site with different tools. This will add a verification meta tag on your homepage. You can find instructions on how to verify your site for each platform by following the link in the description.

This Yoast SEO REST API endpoint gives y: This Yoast SEO REST API endpoint gives you all the metadata you need for a specific URL. This will make it very easy for headless WordPress sites to use Yoast SEO for all their SEO meta output.
The Yoast SEO admin bar menu contains us: The Yoast SEO admin bar menu contains useful links to third-party tools for analysing pages and makes it easy to see if you have new notifications.
Allows for Twitter to display a preview: Allows for Twitter to display a preview with images and a text excerpt when a link to your site is shared.
Allows for Facebook and other social med: Allows for Facebook and other social media to display a preview with images and a text excerpt when a link to your site is shared.
Facebook, Twitter and Pinterest all use: Facebook, Twitter and Pinterest all use Facebook's Open Graph data, so be sure to keep the 'Open Graph data' setting below enabled if you want to optimise your site for these social platforms.
Tell us which features you want to use.
Usage tracking allows us to track some d: Usage tracking allows us to track some data about your site to improve our plugin. %1$sAllow us to track some data about your site to improve our plugin%2$s.
Enable the XML sitemaps that Yoast SEO g: Enable the XML sitemaps that Yoast SEO generates.
This image is used as a fallback for pos: This image is used as a fallback for posts/pages that don't have any images set.

The %1$sSite image%2$s requires Open Gra: The %1$sSite image%2$s requires Open Graph data, which is currently disabled in the ‘Social sharing’ section in %3$sSite features%4$s.
You can use %1$sSite title%2$s, %1$sTagl: You can use %1$sSite title%2$s, %1$sTagline%2$s and %1$sSeparator%2$s as variables when configuring the search appearance of your content.
Automatically add content to your RSS. T: Automatically add content to your RSS. This enables you to add links back to your blog and your blog posts, helping search engines identify you as the original source of the content.
Max number of characters to allow in sea: Max number of characters to allow in searches
Filter searches with common spam pattern: Filter searches with common spam patterns
Filter searches with emojis and other sp: Filter searches with emojis and other special characters
Automatically ping search engines like B: Automatically ping search engines like Bing and Yandex whenever you publish, update or delete a post.
This adds an author byline and reading t: This adds an author byline and reading time estimate to the article’s snippet when shared on Slack.
We have both free and premium online cou: We have both free and premium online courses to learn everything you need to know about SEO.
Want to learn SEO from Team Yoast? Check: Want to learn SEO from Team Yoast? Check out our %1$s!
An organization name and logo need to be: An organisation name and logo need to be set for structured data to work properly. %1$sLearn more about the importance of structured data%2$s.
You can edit the SEO metadata for this c: You can edit the SEO metadata for this custom type on the %1$sShop page%2$s.
The text link counter helps you improve: The text link counter helps you improve your site structure.
The cornerstone content feature lets you: The cornerstone content feature lets you to mark and filter cornerstone content on your website.
The readability analysis offers suggesti: The readability analysis offers suggestions to improve the structure and style of your text.
The SEO analysis offers suggestions to i: The SEO analysis offers suggestions to improve the SEO of your text.
A link to your site, with your site's na: A link to your site, with your site's name and description as anchor text.
